sif3.infra.common.env
Class EnvironmentStore

java.lang.Object
  sif3.infra.common.env.EnvironmentStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class EnvironmentStore
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a POJO that holds the infromation about environments as defined adpater's property file. It also maintains an apprporiate directory structure to store and retrieve environemnt data (as XML files). It will ensure a strict directory structure for consumer and provider environments. It assumes that property file called 'environment.properties' exists and is on the classpath. This file holds the root directory of the environmenty store (consumer and provider).

The environment store is very static and file based. Therefore this class is implemented as a singleton because it is to expensive and operation to access files each time access to an environment is required. SIF3 requires each operation to be validated against and environment and therefore each operation will access the environment store. Another reason to hold it in memory and due to the static nature a singleton makes the most sense.

All operations within this class are NOT exposed to the higher levels of the framework and are fully abstracted form a developer of a service (main intend of this framework). This class forms part of the Environment Porvider each Provider Service would need to implement for DIRECT environments.

Author:
Joerg Huber
